article.Heading: Micromax lines up Rs 500cr capex in 3-4 yr for 5 plants in India
article.Summary: Home-grown phone maker Micromax's co-founder Rajesh Agarwal says they are optimistic on the government's Make in India and Digital India initiatives and expect the upcoming Budget to provide additional push.
article.Body:
Micromax will invest Rs 500 crore over next 3-4 years to manufacture mobile handsets and components in India, says the home-grown phone maker's co-founder Rajesh Agarwal, in an interview to CNBC-TV18.

We aim to take up complete manufacturing from components to assembling in India to increase localisation, Agarwal says, highlighting plans to set up 5 manufacturing units across Rajasthan, Madhya Pradesh and Andhra Pradesh.

He is optimistic about the government's Make in India and Digital India initiatives and expects the upcoming Budget to provide additional push.
